Yoneda Lemma August 1, 2021 Bridging the gap between formal and informal presentations of the Yoneda Lemma.
The Hask Category June 1, 2021 A quick reference for understanding the Hask category of Haskell functions between data types.
Expectation Maximization November 26, 2015 These notes provide a theoretical treatment of **Expectation-Maximization**, an iterative parameter estimation algorithm used to find local maxima of the likelihood function in the presence of hidden variables. Introductory textbooks (MLAPP, PRML) typically state the algorithm without explanation and expect students to work blindly through derivations. We find this approach to be unsatisfying, and instead choose to tackle the theory head-on, followed by plenty of examples. Following (Neal & Hinton 1998), we view expectation-maximization as coordinate ascent on the **Evidence Lower Bound**. This perspective takes much of the mystery out of the algorithm and allows us to easily derive variants like **Hard EM** and **Variational Inference**.
